Hi everyone, the old technical report "Patterns Without Development" 
has b=
een removed and replaced with a journal paper that is going to 
be appearin=
g the journal of Genetic Programming and Evolvable 
Machines.  The new jour=
nal paper is called, "Compositional Pattern 
Producing Networks: A Novel Ab=
straction of Development," and is 
available on the EPlex publications page=
 here (sure to be messed up 
by yahoo):

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/index.php?=

option=3Dcom_content&task=3Dview&id=3D14&Itemid=3D28#stanley.gpem07

Or yo=
u can just go to the publications area of 
http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu
and scro=
ll down. Or my homepage under "Journal Papers."

This paper significantly i=
mproves upon the old tech report because 
it has been through a peer review=
 process that forced it to address 
the big questions (some of which Ian ju=
st raised).  

So even if you read "Patterns Without Development," if you a=
re 
interested in CPPNs this may still be worth a read.   The paper 
tries =
to make a serious, detailed argument for CPPNs as a valid 
abstraction of d=
evelopment that is equal in power to other 
abstractions.

(Of course, it's=
 a bit long at 36 pages, so if you want a shorter 
intro then "Exploiting R=
egularity Without Development" is a good 
choice at only 8 pages.

Please n=
ote that this paper is about CPPNs in general and not 
HyperNEAT, although =
it briefly mentions how it will be extended to 
HyperNEAT in the discussion=
 section.

ken
